cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 310 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana and 435 miles SSW of Mobile, Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to arc northeast across the Deep South and Appalachians toward the Mid-Atlantic coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in the Mid-Atlantic; tropical-storm watches cover Intracoastal City LA eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-Storm Warning from Intracoastal City, LA to the Okaloosa/Walton County line, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast initially (LA-MS-AL-FL Panhandle) then interior Southeast and Appalachians; Mid-Atlantic could see rain and gusty winds early next week
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 20–30 mph possible as remnant low passes nearby early next week
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Chesapeake Bay from this system
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Tuesday into Wednesday with locally higher amounts
weather_observation.other_hazards: Very low-end risk of an isolated short-lived tornado in the Mid-Atlantic if moisture and shear align, but confidence is low
